description: The scheme is centrally sponsored and shared by Central and State Govt. on 50:50 basis. Financial Assistance is provided to old aged persons of 60 \na0years age and above, living below poverty line (BPL)

procedures.step_description: The application forms are available with DSWO/TSWO free of cost. The applicant has to complete the application form and enclose proof regarding age, income, status and address. Complete case is to be submitted to the concerned Tehsil Social Welfare officer against proper receipt.

The concerned Tehsil Social Welfare Officer (TSWO) consolidates the list of eligible applicants under the scheme and forwards it to the concerned District Social Welfare Officer for arrangement of funds and accord of sanction by a designated District level Sanctioning Committee headed by Director General, Social Welfare Department, Kashmir.

title: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS)

description: Old aged men and women with no source of income are provided financial support in the form of pension. Applicants shall be 60 years and above in case of males and 55 years or above in case of females and the applicant should have meager source of income.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Old aged men and women with no source of income
Women in distress, including destitute, separated, divorced or widow
Persons with 40% or more disability and having no source of income

title: Old Age Pension (OAP)

criteria.description: Age: 18-79 years with severe or multiple disabilities

description: With the aim to provide social security to the marginal workers having meager income the department has formulated this scheme to provide financial support on contributory basis. Marginal workers include Agricultural and Non-Agricultural Labourer, Rural Barber, Craftsman, Blacksmith, Shepherd, Masons, Weavers etc.
title: Contributory Social Security Scheme (CSSS)

description: Post-matric Scholarship for Physically Challenged, SC & OBC Students
title: Post-matric Scholarship for Physically Challenged, SC & OBC Students

criteria.description: For OBC and physically challenged students income limit of parents/guardians should not exceed Rs. 1.00 lacs/year.
In case of Physically Challenged, the disability should be 40% and above and should be studying in recognized institutions for professional/academic courses.
The student should not be receiving simultaneously any other scholarship from any other Institution for any other course under any other category.
For Scheduled Caste/Pahari students the scholarship is available for students at post Matric or Post Graduation level.
Income limit of parents/guardians is Rs. 2.00 Lacs per year
The students must be from SC/Pahari speaking category, and studying in recognized institutions for undergoing various professional/academic courses.
The student is not in receipt of any other scholarship under any other institution/course/category.

description: The document outlines different scholarship schemes available at the district level, particularly focusing on supporting students from marginalized communities.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Children of those Engaged in Unclean Occupation

title: DISTRICT LEVEL SCHOLARSHIP SCHEMES

criteria.description: School attendance required for all classes is 80% and above
Minimum marks obtained should be 50% and above for class VI-VIII and 55% and above for class IX-X in previous exam qualified.
For all classes the income of parents/guardians should not exceed Rs. 2100/- per month
Students who belong to OBC category and are pursuing various technical courses in the district in Industrial Training Institutes

title: Pre-matric Scholarship to Students belonging to National Minorities

description: The Department is providing grant-in-aid to registered voluntary organizations for various welfare schemes like income generations, running of homes for destitute/ orphans etc.

procedures.step_description: Applications for grant-in-aid shall be submitted by the NGO/Institutions on the prescribed format (form-“A”) supported by the requisite document in the 1st quarter of each financial year but not latter than 30th June.
The concerned Distt. Social Welfare Officers after have complete all the requisite formalities shall submit the grant-in-aid cases to the Director by or before the end of September.
The Director Social Welfare shall submit the same to the Administrative Department by the end of November.

title: Grant in Aid to NGO's
